author: Staff report
title: CT man arrested after officers allegedly find drugs worth $18K in car after fleeing police
text:
A Connecticut man was charged after officers allegedly found around $18,000 worth of narcotics, including fentanyl and crack cocaine, in his vehicle after he attempted to flee from police and struck multiple cars.
Bridgeport Police Department officers allegedly observed a black BMW driving recklessly on various streets in the North End, East Side and back in the North End of the city at different times of the day on Dec 12, according to Danielle Wedderburn, director of communications for the city of Bridgeport,
After failing to conduct a motor vehicle stop multiple times, dispatch informed officers that a vehicle struck several cars on Main Street and Fairview Avenue and a male suspect fled the scene, Wedderburn said.
Shortly after, the suspected driver, identified as 28-year-old Jose Guillermo Rosado of Waterbury, was spotted on Westfield Avenue and taken into police custody, according to Wedderburn.
Police searched the vehicle and reportedly found 1,325 wax folds of a white powder substance which tested positive for fentanyl, 54 grams of a white rock-like substance which tested positive for crack cocaine, 10.5 grams of loose fentanyl rocks, $258 in cash, a scale and sandwich bags, Wedderburn said.
Rosado was arrested and charged with engaging police in pursuit, evading responsibility, failure to obey stop sign, reckless driving, unreadable license plates, interfering with an officer, possession with intent to sell narcotics and operating a drug factory. He was being held on a $150,000 bond, according to Wedderburn.
